intro: Chrysanthemum grandiflorum, commonly known as the garden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a wide range of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–150 cm and prefers well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually lobed and gray-green in color, while the flowers bloom in the fall. Chrysanthemum grandiflorum is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional medicine.
